トピック.授業計画1:
In this course, learners will learn how to set effective goals to guide their language learning as well as interact in-class using a variety of task types. The course will also include assessed presentations and group discussions. Indicative content:

Presentation planning and practice
Improving presentation delivery using video and in-class materials.
Short discussion tasks of around 5 ~ 10 minutes (both assessed and unassessed)
Improving use of selected discussion skills through watching of in-class video and awareness raising tasks.
Exploring and evaluating a range of tasks to facilitate independent study in English; learners will try these tasks and discuss how useful they were in class.
Encounter and use a wide range of self-access materials freely available on the internet and use for independent learning.
Setting effective goals to direct English-language learning.
Building vocabulary by identifying, recording and practising new words that emerged through self-study tasks and discussion/presentation practice.

Full schedule details of class content, homework and assessments will be given on LUNA throughout the semester.

NOTE The above content will be modified and adapted to suit the learners’ abilities.
トピック.授業外学習2:
Course participants will need to complete various homework and independent study tasks. Students should spend a minimum of 1 hour on homework tasks. Homework tasks include (but are not limited to)


Complete one self-study task each week and evaluate its pros, cons and level of difficulty.
Use and evaluate a range of self-study materials for listening and reading.
Keep a record of self-study tasks in the learner portfolio.
Prepare for discussions and presentations.
Select, record and practice new vocabulary encountered through the course.
